title: (x) Film Festival laurels {Chesh}
content:
Does anyone know of a dingbat font that has the leafs?   
 ![festival award](http://web.archive.org/web/20120502160422im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/36371.jpg)
author: anonymous

comments.content:
I have this crappy collection of ancient (1995) EPS clip art, and in it I found three laurels that you might like. Every once in a while this stupid thing comes in handy.   
   
The forum isn't letting me upload the EPS file (or a PDF, for that matter). [Email me directly](mailto:cheshire@cheshiredave.com) for it. Anyone else who wants it is welcome to it as well.

Oh. OK, let's see...

laurels
laurels.eps (738.0 k)

And good idea about the movie, Yves -- thanks!
Illustrator has leafs has a border. You could draw your path shape, apply the leaf border, expand and scale as needed.

Hey Chesh you could use those for your [movie project](http://web.archive.org/web/20120502160422/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/35819.html?1085084881). ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20120502160422im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
BTW You _CAN_ upload EPS or PDF via the [attach](http://web.archive.org/web/20120502160422/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/discus.pl?pg=formatting#images) format.
Davy's Dingbats has something kind of like it... but you'd have to play around with it in Illustrator. When I needed these (called laurels I think) I just scanned in the newspaper.
